content.rendered:
Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis we’re riding the wave of three new themes. Plus, there’s free migrations to StudioPress Sites (for a limited time), and a little inspiration from Genesis lead developer, Nathan Rice.

Themes

WP Studio is one of my favourite Genesis theme shops and their new WooCommere friendly theme Accent Pro does not disappoint either!

Say hello to Accent Pro a high quality eCommerce Genesis theme. #GenesisWP #WordPress #wordpressthemes https://t.co/2SxDQCOzlR pic.twitter.com/OusfkWYImd

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) February 20, 2017

SEO Themes seems to have a new theme out almost every week at the moment and Architect Pro is another (good looking) new edition.

NEW THEME – https://t.co/4li9VWjuA1

Architect Pro Genesis Child Theme. Get it here https://t.co/HvjqTb54Oo#genesiswp #wordpress

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) February 22, 2017

Here's another demo of Architect Pro with a custom color scheme. Check it out! https://t.co/7ae4fn3CVx #GenesisWP #WordPress

— Seo Themes (@seothemeswp) February 22, 2017

If you like Calvin Koepke’s new site (see Showcase below), you can also download the theme for free.

Hey #genesiswp folks: You can download my current theme for free — https://t.co/w4U17STahp

— Calvin (@cjkoepke) February 22, 2017

Showcase

First up this week, Dan Rippon from Spiniflex Media on their new site for howestudios.com.au

Starting with the Infinity child theme, and with Jamie Mitchell from JM Designs providing some code edits, the build features gratuitous use of the Envira Gallery plugin, a WooCommerce store, plus Gravity Forms integration to both the store and the Táve Business Management CRM.

New #genesiswp site launch for Sydney's award winning photographer, Howe Studios. https://t.co/J5ITVx0HCS pic.twitter.com/3UqPvVVbtd

— Spinifex Media (@spnfxmedia) February 20, 2017

Loves this from Kevin Donnigan for his own site, anythinggraphic.net

By the by, I have a new website 🙂 #genesiswp #wordpress #webdesign #webdevelopment – https://t.co/RKBw8i8Pzh pic.twitter.com/VCzcGaSWOl

— Kevin Donnigan (@anythinggraphic) February 20, 2017

Wes Straham shares a customisation of his Aspire theme by yourmedlife.com

Check out what @YourMedLife did with the Aspire Theme! – https://t.co/vZTeQ8YcW7 #genesiswp #WordPress

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) February 23, 2017

Lemonade Stand for strongholdmotorsports.com

Check out the new site for @StrongholdMotor we just launched on #wordpress #genesiswp: https://t.co/MoIEYMAVyi

— Lemonade Stand (@LemonadeStnd) February 21, 2017

Cami MacNamara for carlwilliamsinteriors.com

I'm super excited to share this website redesign of my longtime client, Carl Williams #genesiswp… https://t.co/Zo9rtMD8NZ

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) February 22, 2017

Creative Visual Design for spoonbreadbistro.com

New website for @spoonbreadbistr in Richmond, VA #RVAhttps://t.co/iSwlm06Snv#webdesign #webdesigners #genesiswp @studiopress pic.twitter.com/DJP5LwZBmG

— CreativeVisualDesign (@CreativeVisual) February 23, 2017

Archer Creative with a new book page for dandibooks.com

Just launched a book page for our friends at Tyndale Publishing for author Dandi Mackall: https://t.co/3nt0CAUiaa #genesiswp #bookmarketing pic.twitter.com/b8Yt4IwRqD

— Archer Creative (@Archer_Creative) February 22, 2017

…and a new site for bluefishmedical.com

Catching up on sharing some recent site launches. Here’s one we recently launched for healthcare vendor https://t.co/xFlKQJchv2 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/XI6dgS5ABC

— Archer Creative (@Archer_Creative) February 21, 2017

Barrie North with a new site, based on the Aspire Pro theme, for see3dcamo.com

New site launch https://t.co/54ez5vRJm2 with AspirePro, 4 hours build with prewritten copy only possible with #genesisWP #WordPress pic.twitter.com/iBrM5WphQf

— Barrie North (@compassdesign) February 21, 2017

And in case you skipped over the Themes section, make sure you check out Calvin Koepke’s latest redesign for calvinkoepke.com

Psss…soft launch: https://t.co/H5PIyyWZvo

— Calvin (@cjkoepke) February 22, 2017

Best of the rest

Sridhar Katakam shows you how to disable wpautop on specific pages in Genesis.

How to disable wpautop on specific Page(s) in Genesis:https://t.co/EutRAVtenx#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) February 24, 2017

Neil Gee shows you how to use icons in Genesis meta and change the Genesis post entry meta output.

Use Icons in Genesis Meta & Change the Genesis Post Entry Meta Output https://t.co/cOoz3rLGPw

— Neil Gee (@_neilgee) February 23, 2017

StudioPress is offering a free migration to their new StudioPress Sites platform but only through 27 Feb 2017 (tomorrow at the time of writing). Here’s their instructions on to do it:

  • Choose your [StudioPress Sites] plan and billing cycle to check out.
  • You’ll be guided through the site setup process.
  • On the screen that says your site is ready, click the ‘See Migration Options’ button.
  • Choose the Fantasktic migration option.
  • Create an account at Fantasktic and submit your site for migration.
  • Check your email for the payment link, then use the code MOVE for your free migration.

And finally…

Here’s a little inspiration from Nathan Rice (thanks to Tony Clark for collating it).

This @nathanrice thread is so cool, I made it a Moment… #genesiswp https://t.co/oqSreAUlmB

— Tony D. Clark (@nestguy) February 20, 2017

Something to add? Share it via the homepage of this site and I’ll  include my favourites in next week’s round-up.

excerpt.rendered: Three new themes, free migrations to StudioPress Sites (for a limited time), and a little inspiration from Genesis lead developer, Nathan Rice.
